hero.description: Expert insights on SEO, internal linking, and AI-powered content strategies — straight from the Dofollo team.

featured_post.title: What is Dofollo? The AI Semantic Internal Linking Tool
featured_post.excerpt: As an SEO professional, you understand how important an internal linking strategy is. Discover how Dofollo helps you audit, plan, and automate your internal links.

posts.title: What is Dofollo?
posts.excerpt: As an SEO professional, you understand how important an internal linking strategy is for your organic rankings. Discover how Dofollo helps you build and implement your strategy with ease.
posts.content:
As an SEO professional, you understand how important an internal linking strategy is for your organic rankings. However, planning and implementing an internal linking strategy could be a time-consuming endeavor. 

Fortunately, Dofollo is here to help you build and implement your internal linking strategy on any website with ease.   

If you are running an SEO agency or working as a freelancer, you don't want to spend a lot of time doing the grunt work of auditing your internal links & finding new internal link oppertunities. You need an SEO tool that will help you implement the internal linking strategy efficiently and not make you do a lot of unwanted, time-consuming, and mind-numbing tasks.  

There are a few tools are available that promise to help with the internal linking process, but most of them are mainly focused on checking keyword positions rather than on the internal link-building strategy. 

For example, using Ahrefs or Google Search Console tools can help you find your existing internal links to some extent. However, they have limitations, as they do not fare very well when it comes to finding internal linking opportunities and adding those links to your website is a manual & tedious task.

If you have a WordPress website, there are some plugins available in the WordPress ecosystem which helps you with the internal linking opportunities. However, these plugins can only suggest the outgoing link from a page you are currently working on. This can be challenging for building a strong internal linking strategy, as you can't see any suggestions for incoming links, especially when you are publishing a spanking new blog post.  

Dofollo can reduce your headache by making this internal link-building process much easier. Dofollo gives you a top-level view of your current internal links and shows you new internal link opportunities based on AI recommendations for building more internal links. 

In addition, Dofollo allows you the unique ability to add the newly planned links to your website from the Dofollo console itself without having to visit your website, and that too with the right anchor text.

What can Dofollo do? 

  1. Audit Internal Links
  2. Find Internal Linking Opportunities
  3. Add New Internal Links to Your Website.
  4. Remove Unnecessary Internal Links

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

Audit Internal Links

To implement any internal linking strategy, first you need to know the current status of your internal links. In Dofollo, you can visualize the incoming and outgoing links (including backlinks and external links) for any given page on your website on a single screen. This visualisation helps you build a better understanding of your current status on internal links.

In the above image, you can see the incoming links and outgoing links for the pricing page of RabbitLoader.com, as well as the number of backlinks and external links.

With Dofollo you visualize the top level overview, which helps you with comprehending the status of internal linking for any given page. 

The visualization of the incoming & outgoing links allows you to make informed decisions on whether you need to make changes to your internal linking strategy.

Find Internal Linking Opportunities

Manually finding internal linking opportunities can be time consuming & most of the time you are just relying on your intuition, especially when it comes to a large website. Dofollo AI will suggest internal linking opportunities to improve your ranking in Search Engine Result Pages (SERPs).  

As you can see in the image, clicking on the "Make Plan" button would show the internal linking opportunities. The suggestions are generated using AI to give you the best possible linking opportunity. 

You can also add the links manually or change the anchor text of the AI suggested links if you need.

Dofollo suggests both incoming as well as outgoing linking opportunities. 

Add Potential Internal Links

A few SEO tools out there can provide suggestions for internal linking opportunities, but you need to add internal links to the page by logging in to the website then navigating to each page & finally selecting the anchor text & create the link, which takes time.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

However, with Dofollo, you don't need to spend your time on editing the pages. With just a few clicks, Dofollo would add the internal links to your website with the right anchor text right from the Dofollo admin panel. All you need to do is input your login credentials of your website when prompted.

As shown in the image, just clicking on the "add" button under the action section, would automatically add the new internal link to the planning page. Finally, to add the link on your website or blog just click "Save" & "Apply" buttons.

Remove Unnecessary Internal Links

After visualizing the internal links of a page, if you notice the presence of any unnecessary links, you can easily delete them right from the Dofollo console with just a couple of clicks. You don't need to waste any of your time trying to locate the link on the website. 

As shown in the image, first you need to enable deletion by turning on the toggle button. By clicking on any of the links present in the graphical view you can get rid of the unwanted link.

Along with these key features, Dofollo also has some additional features. Let's explore them.

Learn Internal Linking Strategy of Your Competitor

If you are not sure how you should create a backlink strategy for your website, we got you covered. With Dofollo you can check how your competitor or a high performing website is doing to improve their SEO.

Just add your competitors website in Dofollo & wait for a few minutes, that's it. You would be able to see the internal linking strategy of any website of your choice.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

posts.title: 3 Simple Ways You Can Find Internal Links to Any Page with Ease
posts.excerpt: Time is money. Learn 3 efficient ways to audit your website's internal links using Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Dofollo to improve your SEO rankings.
posts.content:
As an SEO expert, you know how crucial your internal linking strategy can be. But to implement an internal linking strategy you must be able to see the existing internal links to your target page. 

But if you are working on a website with a lot of pages, it could be an overwhelming task to find internal links that already exist to your target page.

We would show you 3 different ways you can audit your website easily to find all the internal links to any page you are working on so you can spend your time doing more rewarding SEO tasks.

Understanding Internal Linking With An Example

In simple terms, internal links indicate the hyperlinks that can redirect visitors & search engine bots to different pages in the same website or domain.

The key goal of building an effective internal linking strategy is to pass the page's authority to a low-ranking page, which can help the web page rank higher in Search Engine Result Pages (SERPs).

Note: If the link points to a web page of a different website or domain instead of the same website, it is known as an external link. 

The Importance Of Internal Links in SEO

Let's concentrate on the importance of building a strong internal linking strategy:

  1. A strong internal linking strategy helps pass the page authority/ link equity.
  2. A well-structured internal linking strategy improves the crawling and indexing of your website.
  3. Providing relevant internal links can increase a website's average on-page time.

A Strong Internal Linking Strategy Helps to Pass the Page Authority / Link Equity

Getting authoritative backlinks is not only difficult, but it would also be a costly affair. While getting authoritative internal links from your website is within your control & doesn't need you to spend any money.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

A Well-Structured Internal Linking Strategy Improves the Crawling and Indexing of a website

In order to determine the ranking of a web page in SERPs, first a search bot needs to crawl the web page and index the page. A strong, well-structured internal linking strategy can generate a pathway that leads a search bot to crawl and index the page's content more frequently.

Providing Relevant Internal Links Can Increase a Website's Average On-Page Time.

Providing the relevant internal links on a page can enhance the user experience.

Average on-page time indicates the span of time a user spends on a website. Engaging the user with the website's content can significantly improve the website's on-page time.

How To Find Internal Links To A Page

Here are 4 reasons to find internal links to the page before implementing a link building strategy.

  • Plan implementation of internal linking strategy
  • Identify the broken internal links
  • Find the orphan pages
  • Find the internal linking opportunities

Identify The Broken Internal Links

A broken internal link indicates a link in the page that redirects to another page of the same website that doesn't exist. It is essential to audit the internal linking strategies to identify the broken links & fix them.

Find The Internal Linking Opportunities

When a new web page or blog post is published, finding internal linking opportunities is important to give it some link juice.

Fortunately, Dofollo is here to create internal links a little bit easier. Dofollo shows you the internal link opportunity for both incoming & outgoing links for any given page on your website.

How To Find Internal Links To A Page

Let's discover the three ways to find internal links efficiently and quickly:

  1. Find the internal links using Ahref
  2. Using Google Search Console
  3. Find internal links by using Dofollo

Find the Internal Links using Ahref

You can use an SEO tool like Ahrefs. Here, you can see the incoming and outgoing links of a page.

Here, you can see that Ahrefs only shows contextual links (not header, footer, etc), which is an additional advantage of Ahrefs over Google Search Console.

The caveat with Ahref is it is quite expensive & it doesn't suggest you the link opportunities.

Search for Internal Links Using Google Search Console

If you are looking for a free tool, you can use the Google Search Console tool to find internal links to any page of your website easily.

In the GSC you can see the internal links and external links of a web page. However, the main drawback is it shows you unnecessary links including links in menus, footer tags, and pagination.

Finding Internal Links By Using Dofollo

Using Dofollo can help you discover your current links, find new internal link opportunities & even help you add or remove the internal links to your website.

Here, you can see the linking structure (incoming links and outgoing links) of a page on RabbitLoader.com.

Conclusion: Why Is Dofollo A Good Choice?

Without building a strong internal linking strategy, ranking top in the Search Engine Result Pages (SERPs) can be very challenging.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

posts.title: 10 Best Internal Linking Practices For Better Rankings
posts.excerpt: Internal linking is crucial for SEO. We curated a list of 10 best practices to help you create internal links with a clear aim to rank your target pages higher.
posts.content:
Internal Linking is crucial for SEO. A balanced on-page optimization should include creating relevant internal links for your pages and blog posts for better SEO rankings.

Here, we have curated a list of best practices for internal linking that helps you create internal links with a clear aim to rank your target pages higher.

What Is An Internal Link?

Internal links are essentially bridges to another destination. The idea of contextual internal links is to help the audience of your website or blog to find more information about a topic.

Why Are Internal Links Important For SEO

Internal links have the same principle as backlinks. If you have a page that's ranking well on Google, getting regular traffic or has a lot of good quality links, linking from those pages can help you rank other pages on your website.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

Internal Link Best Practices.

Choosing Your Target Page.

The First step is to choose the page you wish to rank for. The page should be relevant to the central theme of your website.

Discover High Authority Page To Build Internal Links.

How To Find High Authority Pages on Google Search Console

Ensure The Semantic Relation Between Pages

Manage Your Internal Links

Avoid No-follow Links

posts.title: How To Run Internal Link Analysis For Your Landing Pages
posts.excerpt: Landing pages are your money pages. Learn how to analyze and optimize their internal links to drive conversions and improve organic rankings.
posts.content:
Landing pages are the most important pages on your website; they help you reach your business goals by focusing on the most impactful action for your business.

Whether signing up for your newsletter, filling up the lead form or inciting your visitors to click that buy button, a landing page is usually hyper-focused on your business goals.

Any links from or to your landing pages should be built carefully and in consideration. The links should align with your business goal & guide your users to the conversion path.

What are Internal Links?

Internal links are like bridges among your pages; they help your visitors to navigate from one page to another. Ideally, for landing pages, you should mostly build incoming internal links that guide your audience from other website pages to the landing page.

You can build 2 types of links for your landing pages:

  1. Inbound Internal Links: Links from other website pages to your landing pages.
  2. Outbound Internal Links: Links from your landing page to other pages on your website.

Why do you need to build internal links on your landing pages?

The focus primarily is almost always on building incoming internal links to the landing pages. This is especially true if you are trying to rank your landing pages organically.

Building Trust To Boost Conversion Rate.

A good practice is to add internal links to informational pages from your landing page so visitors with buying intent can check out the information they need to take the buy call.

Improve Contextual Relevance

You should link internal pages on your website that share contextual relevance to your landing page. These internal links also pass the page authority to your landing page, improving organic rankings.

Why Do You Need to Build Inbound Internal Links on Your Landing Pages?

Semantic internal links from high authority pages can boost your content's ranking if they are done correctly.

How To Analyze The Internal Link On Your Landing Page?

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

Dofollo helps you find out the incoming and outgoing internal links of a page in just a few seconds.

How To Build Internal Links For Landing Pages.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links
  1. Find pages on your website that are semantically relevant to your landing page.
  2. Figure out which of those related pages have high authority.
  3. Link the high authority pages that share relevancy with your landing page using descriptive anchor text.

This way, you can create as many internal links as you need to rank your pages right from the Dofollo console without visiting your or your client's website.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings

Check Your Internal Links

posts.title: How Readability Affects SEO: The Complete Guide
posts.excerpt: Modern SEO focuses heavily on user experience. Learn why readability matters, how it impacts dwell time, and how to optimize your content for both humans and search engines.
posts.content:
Search engine optimization is no longer just about adding keywords or building backlinks. Modern SEO focuses heavily on user experience, and one of the most important — yet often ignored — parts of user experience is readability.

You can write the most informative article in the world, but if people struggle to read it, they will leave within seconds. When users leave quickly, search engines interpret that behavior as a sign of poor content quality. As a result, your rankings drop.

This is exactly why SEO Readability matters more today than ever before.

Readable content keeps visitors engaged, improves dwell time, reduces bounce rates, and sends strong positive signals to Google's ranking algorithm. In short, good readability equals better SEO performance.

What is Readability?

Readability refers to how easy it is for readers to understand your content quickly and effortlessly. It measures several factors, such as:

  • Sentence length
  • Word complexity
  • Paragraph structure
  • Grammar clarity
  • Flow and organization
  • Visual formatting

If your content uses short sentences, simple words, and clear formatting, readers can process the information easily. That means high readability.

If your content uses long sentences, technical jargon, and large blocks of text, readers feel confused or tired. That means low readability.

Does Readability Impact SEO?

The simple answer is yes — readability directly affects SEO performance.

While Google does not publicly say "we rank readability scores," it clearly measures user behavior. And the readability formula strongly influences that behavior.

When your content is easy to read, users:

  1. Stay longer
  2. Scroll further
  3. Interact more
  4. Visit other pages

These are powerful ranking signals.

Dwell Time

Dwell time refers to how long a visitor stays on your page before returning to search results.

If someone clicks your page and leaves within 5 seconds, Google assumes: "This page didn't help the user." But if they stay for 3–5 minutes, Google thinks: "This content is useful and engaging."

Readable content increases dwell time because users want to keep reading.

Manage Your Internal Links
with AI for Better SEO Rankings
